article_node.title: Former Texas WR Isaiah Bond cleared of charges, announces heâ€™s joining Browns
article_node.summary: Isaiah Bond, a former Texas Longhorns wide receiver, has been cleared of sexual assault charges by a Collin County grand jury, which returned a 'no bill' decision, meaning no indictment will be issued. Following this outcome, Bond expressed gratitude for the decision and announced his eligibility to continue his NFL career, specifically mentioning the Cleveland Browns' support. Despite the legal issues affecting his draft prospects, Bond's college performance included 34 catches for 540 yards and five touchdowns in his final season.
